Reviews.Content: Terrible We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights as part of an organized tour of Italy. Places to stay in this hotel - it is very unpleasant impression that I have left after the visit. Inside the hotel like the Catacombs. The rooms are very small, everything is very old, dirty walls and floors. Shower cubicle such narrow that you can only go sideways. But if anyone had gone inside and managed to include water, it heard all guests of this hotel In future never will stay in this place.
Reviews.Author: AlexIng

Reviews.Content: Really noisy pipes! Had to change rooms as the first was really small and I could not get into the shower cubicle at all..the tour leader had explained this and the next room was bigger. Clean room,sheets and bathroom but the noise from the pipes meant one up, allup. Breakfast was just about OK. Usual Cosmos tour quality.
Reviews.Author: Mrsheathershaw

Reviews.Content: clean, tiny shower and very noisy pipes! Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights as part of our Cosmos tour. The room was an adequate size for a twin, clean with modern fittings and comfy beds. However the shower was tiny with no room to move to wash...also the hot water ran out on both mornings! The rooms are also noisy, you can hear all the pipe works every time someone flushes the loo and when people are having a shower it sounds like water is going to come through! No noise from the station though!Breakfast and dinner were included and were of an average/poor standard, however if you have a walk around Signa about 5 mins from the hotel we found a lovely restaurant which was very popular with local people and it was very nice. There are also pizza places and bars within walking distance.
Reviews.Author: missyd17

Reviews.Content: unkind and very dirty the worst hotel in Italy
Reviews.Author: drakerai

Reviews.Content: Clean, convenient by train Stayed here in May with the Splendors of Italy tour with Cosmos with my husband.Hotel is way outside Florence in the next to next town! BUT, by train it is just 23 mins and costs about 2-3 euro for a pleasant journey. By the tour bus it takes 1 hour to Florence cos of traffic. Rooms are no longer noisy(as mentioned in some earlier reviews), we had a room right next to the train station facing the platform but couldn't hear a thing...window glass is good at shutting out the noise, air conditioning works, rooms are clean, bathroom was large and airy, room was a decent size. Tour group breakfast was not bad with boiled eggs available and some great fresh pineapple , freshly squeezed juices and the usual coffee/tea and breads. Try and wake up a little early because the brekafast room is small so people end up queing up if they arrive even a minute after the start of breakfast time.My advice - Florence has plenty to see and do and shop for plus many great restaurants. The train is cheap and quick, so skip the included dinner which we heard was quite average, spend the extra 2-3 euro on train + 6-8 eur on dinner and enjoy extra time from 3pm to 9 or 10pm in Florence. Your group will have to leave Florence by 3pm and then spend 1.5 hrs in traffic and then sit in the hotel in the lifeless little town (shops were always shut and NOTHING to see or do in Signa) until 7.30pm when dinner is served at the hotel itself. If you don't like the dinner offered to you, there are no other places to fill up on either since the hotel is in Signa and there are no eateries nearby other than a gelato place behind the hotel.Train station is literally on the doorstep of the hotel so we were comfortable returning here at 10.30pm without worry. Florence is alive and active and a buzzing city so catching a train from the busy Santa Maria Novella in Florence after dark is fine too. TIP 1: Buy your ticket from the fast ticket vending machines with coins rather than queing up at the manned counters. It has many language options so you can be 100% sure you bought a ticket to the right place + you will be sure of the train departure time. At the counter there is always the risk of the Italian counter staff not understanding your Italian or your not understanding his/her English. This vending machine method is fool proof since you type in your destination SIGNA.TIP 2: Always keep some 50 cent and 1/2 euro coins handy for paying for tickets and washrooms through your trip.BEWARE: Some trains in the direction of Signa don't stop there, so check with the info desk and then reconfirm with the train driver before boarding the train that it does stop at Signa. Some folks in our group got the wrong train(an express) and went past Signa without stopping and had to come back from the next stop.
Reviews.Author: ArmchairGypsy

Reviews.Content: Good hotel and excellent value We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the start of our holiday to see Florence without staying in the City. We booked for convenience with it being so close to the station. We had a great stay, we found the staff very helpful and accommodating. The room was a triple and a good size with a long balcony/veranda area. The bathrrom was small but had plenty of toiletries, ample towels and an excellent hairdryer. The airconditioning was the most effective and controllable we had in any hotel during our weeks stay in italy! Breakfast was included in the price and was buffet style with a good choice , the breakfast waitress was especially pleasant. We expected some train noise but to be perfectly honest we hardly heard them The convenience of being within 20 minutes of Florence combined with being in a small hotel, with little noise and a good veiw, means that we will definately be returning. I would like to mention that the pizzaria opposite the hotel is worth a visit we had a good meal again with very accommodating staff who found us a table on a particularly busy night. We felt we had value for money all round.
Reviews.Author: Binnsy007

Reviews.Content: Very average hotel Stayed here as part of a Cosmos tour. The room was dated and air conditioning didn't work. Close to train station and 20 mins to Florence. I had an included meal here as part of the tour. The meal was overcooked and bland. When dinner was over the waiter comes around and asks us for orders of tea or coffee. My capuccino was lukewarm. As we are about to leave, the waiter asks us to pay for the coffees. We assumed it was part of the included meal. After a heated exchange we all eventually cough up the money. The waiter was seen chasing 3 old ladies who had left the dining room without paying assuming the beverages were included. Beware all future Cosmos customers, ask if tea and coffee is included.
Reviews.Author: stevo888

Reviews.Content: OK for a budget tour We were expecting for something like this, not very good, not very bad. We know in advance that the hotel is well far away from Florence, but the train station is right there. When we arrived there the first afternoon, we went to the Information kiosk right in front of the Train station, the lady gave all of the info, we then went to the Bar right on the left of the hotel to buy the tickets, its really inexpensive to get to Florence, you can buy to go and to return ticket in that bar . To go to Florence, take the line 2. Once arrive to Florence, right outside of the train station you will find Cabs park there, you can ask them to go to the Duomo, it's only about 2 miles away, and it will cost about 5 Euro. From Duomo, you can walk around : very close to Porta Rossa, Piazza Signoria, Ponte Vecchio etc...The last train is at about 11pm, so you can have the diner around 7pm, after that you can try to walk back (get the map from the Information kiosk or from your tour Director). We follow the map and it took us only about 10 minutes to walk from Duomo area to the Train Station. REMEMBER: the train to Signa is on line #2, same line when you arrived to Florence. When you look at all the line, you will not see it, but just walk all the way inside the train station, after ,5 and 4, and 3 you don't see it but continue to walk ahead, you will see the line #2.The Hotel is OK, room look clean, bath room look clean but there is a kind of smell like stale. Anyway you only stay there to sleep so it's not a big deal. Breakfast and diner were up to standard.
Reviews.Author: HowieQ

Reviews.Content: Archers 2007 This Hotel is located well outside Florence and Its is right next to the train station. 1. Clean rooms with extra pillows, plenty of hot water, comfortable beds.2. Noisy Hotel coming mainly from flushing tiolets.3. Evening meal included, very goods.One night stay and slept very well.
Reviews.Author: Ainsjane

Reviews.Content: It's NOT Tuscany, definitely NOT Florence Small, ugly, tiny, loud hotel. It's part of the Cosmos package. First of all the hotel lobby is situated across the town plaza, the hotel is split into 2 separate buildings. The hotel is also right next to the rail line which, although it's convenient, it's very noisy. There's only one tiny little pizza stand within the piazza.Signa unfortunately looks like you're in Compton, California. Thank God we only stayed there one night.
Reviews.Author: tedtug

Reviews.Content: Decent hotel but far from Florence This hotel is next to a train station but luckily it was the commuter trains that would run from 6:00 a.m. to late evening. At least it was not running in the middle fo the night.The room is decent in size but the bathroom is very small. There is a very small shower stall with a shower head. The blow dryer is very wimpy. I would suggest bringing your own.I would suggest only using the room to sleep after a day spent in Florence because there's really nothing to do in that area.Breakfast served at the hotel was good and even dinner was pretty good too.
Reviews.Author: mira118

Reviews.Content: Not bad, a little noisy Stayed briefly as part of a Cosmos/Archers tour.The hotel was tidy and clean, our room was very small but very clean. We had an included dinner as part of the tour and it was OK but nothing startling. However, when we were asked which type of coffee we wanted after the dinner it was assumed it was also included but it was not. This is just a little scam to squeeze a few more euros from you.The bar was a bit wierd in that there was a barmaid standing behind it and the drinks were in a fridge on the punter's side. You opened the fridge and handed your drink over and she merely took the top off it and gave you a glass.Also, there seemed to be a lot of ne'er-do-well's charging around on those annoying little scooters trying to impress the local totty. They seemed to be trying to impress well into the small hours which was annoying as we had a VERY early wake up call. You could also hear loos flushing all over the place and really the walls were not very thick.However, for what it was, it was alright. It's really too far from Florence to be touted as a Florence hotel but you pays-a-da-money and you takes-a-da-choice as our tour giude would have put it.
Reviews.Author: The Fat Punter

Reviews.Content: Dire! On the face of it this hotel looks okay, but it is situated in a small square adjacent to the train station, in a very sleepy backwater. We were only here for one night as part of a tour and you therefore believe that you can put up with anything. Our needs are not challenging - just cleanliness. We were put off immediately by the fact that the bathroon towels appeared to have been recycled from the previous clients.There is a small bar across the road from this hotel, but other than that, there was no apparent life in the town, so after 45 minutes walk we returned to the hotel. We really disliked this place. It had no atmosphere. What a relief to get away!
Reviews.Author: planeteer

Reviews.Content: Nice but noisy We had a mixed experience at this hotel. Good points:Small but comfortable roomHelpful staffVery near train station-could get train into Florence very easily.Pleasant location for low-key drinks/pizzeria (Plaza)Restaurant food when not inclusive in packageBar - small but pleasantPacked breakfast when leaving V. early!Ventian glass in the room!Bad points:Very noisy - could hear neighbours bathing/showering/flushing toilet/talkingNoisy TrainsRestaurant food when we ate as a group was far inferior to previous eveningVery small shower
Reviews.Author: mdauvin

Reviews.Content: a heads up My husband and I stayed here with a Cosmos tour. We knew what to expect, so we booked the optional Tuscan Flavours excurtion. (Great fun!) Others on the tour, were not so fortunate. They stayed behind and took the train (10 second walk from the hotel) into town. Get a map from the little brown kiosk between the two hotels. Make sure the train is not, or not going, on strike. The rest of the gang took the train in to town, return tickets purchased at station, only to find out the rail workers were on strike. Apparently this happens quite oftern without notice. It was a pricey cab ride, 30 euros, back to the hotel! Breakfast typical 'Barfay'. Stock up on picnic stuff, and eat it later as brunch. Fruit is fruit, take rolls, cheese, whatever you can wrap in napkins or baggies. You payed for it, take it. If you don't like church bells ringing all night, take earplugs and gravol. It is a long way from town, but you get what you pay for. Some liked the nearby pubs, but we chose to have a glass of our own wine out front of our hotel. The locals were a little intoxicated, and the cigarette smoke a little too much for us.
Reviews.Author: initaly

Reviews.Content: Wonderful little place! Like others who wrote reviews, I stayed here as part of a Cosmos tour. They are correct that it is not a luxurious 5 star resort but my take is that it's not supposed to be. Like the other hotels on the Cosmos tours, this is a good value and is what I expect to see from a European budget place. After all, the hotel is just a place to sleep. I actually liked the fact that the hotel is located in Signa, away from the bustle of Florence. The evenings were quiet and relaxing. My wife and I took a short 10 minute walk and found a lovely restaurant that was a local favorite spot where the friendly staff were fluent in English and excited to show us how a traditional Italian meal should be. The train is literally steps away from the front door and runs regularly giving easy access to downtown Florence. So, if you want black tie concierge service and pretentious little chocolates on your pillow....go somewhere else. If you want a nice, affordable place to stay where you can experience a little Italian life without feeling like a tourist, this is a great place. Of note, we loved our Cosmos Tour and were surprised by how many people on the tour complained about the european style accomodations. It's value travel! We did an entire trip for two of Italy and Greece, including airfare, hotels, meals and all the excursions we could do for less than $5000.00 total...and we never felt like we were getting a bad deal.
Reviews.Author: JayandLin

Reviews.Content: An uncomfortable night I rate this the worst hotel I have stayed at. I am not too picky, I just want a comfortable night's sleep in a clean room. I was given a weird L-shaped room like a corridor. The plumbing in the wall next to the bed was so noisy I could not sleep. I finally pulled the mattress off the bed so I could sleep on the floor. This was not too pleasant as the floor was dirty but I finally got some shuteye. The only plus for this hotel was that it was a couple of train stops from Florence so I could stay late in Florence after the rest of my tour group (Cosmos) left. My tour was a few years ago but I see Cosmos is still using this poor hotel.There was an ancient curling notice in my room - please do not ask to exchange your room as the hotel is full tonight. The room I would have liked to exchange it for was a room in another hotel!
Reviews.Author: verna_zzz

Reviews.Content: Ok, not the best Was a very basic hotel, plain breakfast, ok room, small but cheap. Stayed as part of Cosmos tour.If you are with Cosmos - you will stay here when going to Florence - tolerable hotel.If staying as a tourist - good value, not a great hotel, far from Florence BUT - train is 10 seconds walk away and is fast right in to Florence !!!The great bar people refer to is terrible. There is another bar across the street that is equally terrible. Ok if you want to drink with local/tourist trailer trash - otherwise eat/drink in Florence.
Reviews.Author: MZ-TarvelGuy

Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, bad location We stayed here as part of a Cosmos tour. The location isn't the best. But if you tour guide tells you the only way into town is a one hour bus ride, just hop on the train right next door. You'll be there in 15 minutes.The best part of this hotel is probably the bar in the lounge. Rellay great barman, good selection and they didn't gouge you on prices.
Reviews.Author: michalmm

Reviews.Author: mari59
